pages.text:
Home
/
Amenities
/
Golf
Golf
“We are delighted to have been given the opportunity to return to Windsor and refresh this prized golf course. We kept true to the course’s original design while enhancing the fun factor throughout.”
– Robert Trent Jones, Jr.
Laid out by Robert Trent Jones Jr., Windsor’s 18-hole links-style course is a masterpiece in traditional golf course design.
A unique approach
Windsor’s championship 18-hole golf course was originally designed in 1991 by legendary golf course architect Robert Trent Jones, Jr. Its undulating landscape and wind-shaped trees evoke the Serengeti while the nuances of the par 72 course challenge players of all levels and are appreciated more with every round played. Golfers at Windsor enjoy a no-tee-time policy.
Extensive renovation
In 2019, Robert Trent Jones Jr. returned with his team to carry out an extensive renovation of the 120-acre course that recaptured the original design intent and updated golf holes in concert with today’s game. Highlights of the renovation include replacement of grass on all greens, tees, fairways and roughs; enlargement and reorientation of tee boxes; and restoration of original hole locations and bunker shapes. In order to remain ecologically sensitive and reduce the golf club’s carbon footprint, the renovation introduced a more drought-tolerant variety of Bermuda grass, reduced areas that need to be mowed, and a new state-of-the-art irrigation system.
An extensive renovation of the course in 2019 recaptured the original design intent.
Greater Variety
In addition to a 400-yard driving range, players now also enjoy greater variety in length and angle of approach shots as well as additional and extended target, putting and chipping green areas for more diverse practice scenarios.
The undulating landscape of Windsor’s golf course and its wind-shaped trees evoke the Serengeti.
An undulating panorama of native trees borders gentle, rolling fairways that are completely unobstructed by houses.
DOG FRIENDLY
The club boasts a professional golf shop and personal instruction is available from one of several golf professionals on staff. With no tee times and a dog-friendly policy, the golf club aims to offer the ultimate golfing experience to Members.
Dogs on-leash are welcome on Windsor’s golf course.
Audubon Cooperative Sanctuary Program
In November 2024, Windsor’s golf course was certified by Audubon International as an Audubon Cooperative Sanctuary, joining an elite group of the world’s most sustainable golf clubs. The designation follows a comprehensive evaluation of Windsor’s environmental standards for the golf course and reflects the Club’s dedication to enhancing the area’s natural surroundings and strengthening the local wildlife habitat. The course is now one of about 900 courses in the world to hold this certification.
Read full release

Home
/
Amenities
/
Concierge
Concierge
The welcoming Concierge Suite is a frequent stop for Members and guests.
EXEMPLARY SERVICE
Windsor’s concierge offers an extensive menu of services, including producing important private events, arranging local recreational and cultural outings and assisting Members’ guests.
FULL-SERVICE CONCIERGE
Located in the Concierge Suite in the Village Centre, Windsor’s concierge staff provides Members and guests with a wide array of personalized and professional services. From arranging guest accommodations and assistance with transportation to orchestrating special events and planning exciting local excursions, the concierge team aims to enhance enjoyment of every moment spent in this beautiful seaside community.
A welcoming atrium greets visitors to the Concierge Suite.
Windsor’s concierge staff provides Members and guests with a wide array of personalized and professional services.
BUSINESS MATTERS
Located within the Concierge Suite, a boardroom is well suited for Members’ private meetings or small gatherings.  French doors open to a tranquil butterfly garden. The friendly concierge staff can assist Members with meeting support, notary services, invitation mailing and RSVP tracking and audio and visual needs.
A well appointed boardroom can be reserved for Members’ private meetings.
Next Section:
Guest Accommodations

Home
/
Amenities
/
Private Events
Private Events
Visually stunning, Windsor’s lush seaside locale provides an array of unforgettable settings for private events.
UNFORGETTABLE SETTINGS
With its visually stunning seaside locale, lush landscapes, timeless architecture and impeccable service, Windsor provides a truly unforgettable setting for Members’ family reunions, weddings, corporate affairs and other special celebrations. Whether the event is formal or informal, intimate or grandly scaled, our versatile array of venues delights Members and their guests.
MEMORIES MADE
Windsor holds a special place in Members’ hearts, it has been the setting for countless weddings, birthdays and other family celebrations.  The community boasts a variety of venues for indoor or outdoor special events.
Each season, Member families’ fairytale weddings take place at Windsor’s iconic Town Hall as well as other onsite locations.
A diverse selection of venues at Windsor enables Members to choose the perfect space for any event.
PROFESSIONALLY PLANNED
From intimate dinner parties on the Clubhouse veranda to weekend-long wedding celebrations featuring multiple events throughout the community, Members’ private events are orchestrated by an expert team of event planning and culinary professionals.
From chic cocktail parties to grand weddings, Windsor's experienced event planning team ensures every detail is beautifully orchestrated and picture perfect.
Next Section:
Delivery & Dry Cleaning

Getting Here
The nearest international airports are in Melbourne (MLB), Orlando (MCO) and Palm Beach (PBI). Private planes can fly into Vero Beach Regional Airport (VRB), which is only a 15-minute drive from Windsor. Breeze Airways offers direct flights from various major cities to Vero Beach Regional Airport.
Directions To Windsor
Surface travel directions from the closest airports or your location.

From Melbourne International Airport
From Miami International Airport
From Orlando International Airport
From Palm Beach International Airport
From Vero Beach Regional Airport (Sun Jet Centre)
From Vero Beach Regional Airport (Corporate Air)

←In The News
Windsor Announces PNC Bank as Presenting Sponsor For Eighth Biennial Windsor Charity Polo Cup
August 19, 2025 | Windsor Florida |
Share
The Windsor Charitable Foundation board is pleased to announce the return of PNC Bank as the presenting sponsor for the 2026 Windsor Charity Polo Cup, marking the bank’s fourth time in this prestigious role. Scheduled for Saturday, Feb. 14, 2026, the Windsor Charity Polo Cup is recognized as the signature high-goal charity polo match of the Vero Beach season. Since its inception in 2012, the event has raised more than $2 million for local and national nonprofit organizations.
“Polo has long been a cornerstone of Windsor’s culture, reflecting our community’s deep appreciation for sport and tradition,” says Max Secunda, Windsor’s director of equestrian operations and the event’s match director. “We are proud to once again host the highly anticipated Windsor Charity Polo Cup, and to be supporting three outstanding local charitable organizations.”
Selected by the Windsor membership, the beneficiaries for the 2026 event are Childcare Resources of Indian River, Crossover Mission and the Environmental Learning Center. All three charities selected offer programs to support the basic, educational and enrichment needs of underprivileged children, including community education on the importance of land preservation. While the Polo Cup raised $350,000 in 2022 and $400,000 in 2024, in 2026, the Windsor Foundation aims to significantly surpass its previous fundraising efforts.
“PNC is proud to continue our support of the Windsor Charity Polo Cup and its mission to create lasting change in the Vero Beach community,” said Cressman Bronson, PNC regional president for Southeast Florida. “This event enables us to contribute to organizations that protect our environment and empower the people who call it home.”
In addition to the thrill of world-class polo, the 2026 Windsor Charity Polo Cup will feature an array of interactive events and exhibitions for the entire family to enjoy. Highlights include an elegant fieldside luncheon for 650 guests, junior player match, themed tailgate competition, luxury automobile concours, and an exciting silent auction and raffle.
Corporate and luxury sponsors are quickly signing up, joining Windsor members who are generously supporting the event. Signature corporate and luxury brand sponsors include leading global private aviation group Vista, premier luxury car dealership Porsche, Mercedes-Benz, Audi of Melbourne, L3Harris Technologies, Inc., Tocqueville Asset Management, L.P., Justin Wine, Lewis Cellars, Casa Dragones and Vero Beach Magazine.
The Windsor Charity Polo Cup comes at an exciting time in the community’s evolution as Windsor embarks on its final phase of development with the debut of the North Village, a 47-acre enclave that will include 40 homes, new amenities, and an emphasis on wellbeing. Stretching along the Indian River Lagoon, the North Village will pay tribute to the existing homes on property while placing a heightened emphasis on sustainability and fostering a vibrant, enduring environment for years to come.
Tickets go on sale to the public Sept. 2, 2025. Sponsorships beginning at $6,000 are available for purchase now. Contact Jane Smalley at
[email protected]
or 772 388 8609.
For the latest information on the 2026 Windsor Charity Polo Cup, please visit the website at:
windsorcharitypolocup.com
.
About Windsor and the Windsor Charitable Foundation:
Windsor
Established in 1989, Windsor is a private residential sporting club community spanning 472 acres of lush barrier island between the Indian River and the Atlantic Ocean in Vero Beach, Florida. In the early 1990s, W. Galen Weston and The Hon. Hilary M. Weston of Toronto, Canada visited South Florida in search of a winter home for themselves and their children. In Vero Beach they became enchanted by a property that over the next decades would become a cherished home, passion project and ultimately a critically acclaimed residential community. Windsor was designed by renowned town planners Andrés Duany and Elizabeth Plater-Zyberk in the New Urbanism style of residential living. It offers public and community spaces framed by timeless architecture and landscape design that celebrates its tropical and unspoiled setting. Windsor is comprised of 350 homesites in various styles, including village homes, cottages and country estates, all remarkable for their signature Anglo-Caribbean architecture and gracious living. Residents enjoy privacy and seclusion combined with the finest amenities, exemplary services and sporting activities.
windsorflorida.com
Windsor Charitable Foundation
The Windsor Charitable Foundation’s primary goal is to use the power of philanthropy to change people’s lives and improve the local community. The Foundation raises funds from within the Windsor community, and through fundraising events for the purpose of making grants to fund programs offered by local charitable organizations. Primarily, grants are awarded to support basic human needs such as food, shelter, assistance with disabilities and health issues, children’s education, medical research, protecting the environment and animal advocacy. In addition, the Foundation provides support to Windsor Properties and Club employees experiencing unforeseen hardship.
windsorflorida.com/foundation
About the 2026 Presenting Sponsor and Event Beneficiaries:
PNC Bank
PNC Bank
, National Association, is a member of The PNC Financial Services Group, Inc. (NYSE: PNC). PNC is one of the largest diversified financial services institutions in the United States, organized around its customers and communities for strong relationships and local delivery of retail and business banking including a full range of lending products; specialized services for corporations and government entities, including corporate banking, real estate finance and asset-based lending; wealth management and asset management.
pnc.com
.
Childcare Resources of Indian River
Since 1994, Childcare Resources of Indian River (CCR) has been committed to promoting the highest quality early childhood education and development for economically challenged families. CCR is made up of three core programs: a National Association for the Education of Young Children-accredited early childhood school, a wellness and early intervention program, and professional learning opportunities for early educators. By combining multifaceted programming, a superior learning environment, and unparalleled expertise, CCR provides individualized support to every student, family, and educator it serves. The focus remains on helping children between the ages of six weeks and five years old thrive, while empowering families and early childhood educators to build a stronger foundation for lifelong success.
childcareresourcesir.org
Crossover Mission
Crossover Mission empowers under-resourced youth, ages 11–24, to become successful adults by helping them break the cycle of poverty and build bridges of understanding across cultures. Founded in 2014, the organization serves young people facing financial hardship, academic challenges, emotional stress, and health risks. Programs include: 1. Healthy Kids – Basketball training, fitness, life skills, and mentoring. 2. Academic Mentoring – Personalized tutoring, advocacy, college/career prep and Independent Study. 3. Elite Training & Competitive Travel Basketball – High-level competition and collegiate sports prep. 4. Summer Leadership & Enrichment – Focused on summer growth and experiential learning. Through mentorship, Crossover Mission cultivates character, confidence, accountability, resilience, and opportunity.
crossovermission.com
Environmental Learning Center
The Environmental Learning Center (ELC) is a 64-acre nonprofit nature center in the Indian River Lagoon, dedicated to educating, inspiring, and empowering people of all ages to be active environmental stewards. Since 1988, ELC has provided hands-on, feet-wet learning experiences for thousands through field trips, camps, eco-tours, art exhibits, and sustainability programs. Open daily year-round, ELC connects people to nature in meaningful and lasting ways. With a focus on real-world impact and lifelong learning, the ELC is shaping the next generation of conservation leaders. The ELC is a place for students, parents/grandparents, nature lovers, or anyone who believes in a greener future.
discoverelc.org

Home
/
Amenities
/
Beach Club
Beach Club
A deep loggia with interiors designed by Alessandra Branca is ideal for small- to medium sized gatherings.
Beach Club
Windsor’s Anglo-Caribbean style Beach Club was designed by architect Jaquelin Robertson. The impressive facility includes a welcoming reception area and bar, an elegant restaurant with a veranda overlooking the Atlantic Ocean, a 25-meter pool, a poolside grille and open-air bar. The Beach Club is a popular venue for spectacular wedding receptions and other special occasions.
SALON & BAR
A stylish reception room and vibrant bar reside on the ground floor of the Beach Club. The spaces re-opened in 2022 after an extensive renovation under the artistic eye of designer Alessandra Branca in collaboration with Windsor’s co-founder the Hon. Hilary M. Weston. Pre-dinner drinks or nightcaps, cocktail receptions and special events take place in these convivial spaces. Outside, a deep loggia boasts comfortable seating and is ideal for small- to medium-sized gatherings.
Pre-dinner drinks or nightcaps, cocktail receptions and special events take place in the Salon and Bar.
CABANA BAR
Opened in 2021, the Cabana Bar offers breathtaking pool-to-ocean views from the building’s second story. Flanked by a central bar, the space was concepted as a casual lunch or pre-dinner place where Members can enjoy refreshing cocktails and small plates in the beautiful natural surroundings. Designed by architect Clem Schaub with interiors by Alessandra Branca, this open-air venue is a favorite spot for Members.
Windsor's open-air Cabana Bar boasts breathtaking pool-to-ocean views.
ELEVATED DINING EXPERIENCES
The Beach Club restaurant serves fine regional cuisine under a soaring raftered ceiling in a dining room with sea views. The recently renovated veranda offers a new distinct dining venue for Members and features a coastal Italian menu. At the more casual Poolside Grille, Members can tuck into light fare in shorts and swimsuits while enjoying fresh sea breezes steps from the beach. Specialty cocktails and a small plates menu designed by Executive Chef Justin Schreiber are served in the Cabana Bar.
A distinctive coastal Italian menu is served exclusively at The Veranda.
Protected by natural dunes, the beach at Windsor is accessed by an elevated boardwalk.
PRISTINE BEACH
An elevated boardwalk, designed to preserve the natural dunes, provides beach access from the pool area, where towels, chairs and umbrellas are available for Members and their guests. A private tunnel offers convenient pedestrian and golf cart access from the Village Centre to the oceanside amenities.
Next Section:
Clubhouse

Flanked by a central bar, the space was concepted as a casual lunch or pre-dinner place where Members can enjoy refreshing cocktails and small plates in the beautiful natural surroundings. Designed by architect Clem Schaub with interiors by Alessandra Branca, this open-air venue is a favorite spot for Members.
Windsor's open-air Cabana Bar boasts breathtaking pool-to-ocean views.
ELEVATED DINING EXPERIENCES
The Beach Club restaurant serves fine regional cuisine under a soaring raftered ceiling in a dining room with sea views. The recently renovated veranda offers a new distinct dining venue for Members and features a coastal Italian menu. At the more casual Poolside Grille, Members can tuck into light fare in shorts and swimsuits while enjoying fresh sea breezes steps from the beach. Specialty cocktails and a small plates menu designed by Executive Chef Justin Schreiber are served in the Cabana Bar.
A distinctive coastal Italian menu is served exclusively at The Veranda.
Protected by natural dunes, the beach at Windsor is accessed by an elevated boardwalk.
PRISTINE BEACH
An elevated boardwalk, designed to preserve the natural dunes, provides beach access from the pool area, where towels, chairs and umbrellas are available for Members and their guests. A private tunnel offers convenient pedestrian and golf cart access from the Village Centre to the oceanside amenities.
